steps.title: The numeric code â€œ143â€ stems from Minotâ€™s Ledge Lighthouse.
steps.content: The numeric code â€œ143â€ stems from Minotâ€™s Ledge Lighthouse. In the late 1890s, Lt. Frederick Mahan of the Lighthouse Board advised that all lighthouses have numerical flash sequences. Minotâ€™s Ledge Lighthouse chose a 1-4-3 flash at random (no one knows why), which people on shore associated with the phrase â€œI love you.â€ Afterwards, Minotâ€™s Ledge became known as â€œLoverâ€™s Light.â€ [2] X Research source Some people believe that â€œ143â€ became synonymous with â€œI love youâ€ in 1915. During this time, a new assistant lighthouse keeper, Winfield Scott Thompson, came to Minotâ€™s Ledge, while his family lived on a nearby island. His wife told their kids that the 1-4-3 flash was their fatherâ€™s way of expressing love to them across the water. [3] X Research source
